solution_line_template: On days one, two, and three he sold {cars_per_day_5} cars each day so, {cars_per_day_5} cars + {cars_per_day_5} cars + {cars_per_day_5} cars = <<{cars_per_day_5}+{cars_per_day_5}+{cars_per_day_5}={cars_5days}>>{cars_5days} cars that he sold on those days.

On days 4,5,6 and 7 he sold {cars_per_day_3} cars each day so, {cars_per_day_3} cars + {cars_per_day_3} cars + {cars_per_day_3} cars + {cars_per_day_3} cars = <<{cars_per_day_3}+{cars_per_day_3}+{cars_per_day_3}+{cars_per_day_3}={cars_3days}>>{cars_3days} cars that he sold on those days.

Now we combine the cars he has already sold, which is {cars_5days} cars, and {cars_3days} cars, so {cars_5days} cars + {cars_3days} cars = <<{cars_5days}+{cars_3days}={total_sold}>>{total_sold} cars are sold in total.
If he needs to sell {quota} cars and has already sold {total_sold} cars then {quota} cars - {total_sold} cars = <<{quota}-{total_sold}={cars_left}>>{cars_left} cars left to sell to meet his quota.
